text: Andrew White (September 6, 1942 – November 11, 2020) was an American jazz and R&B; multi-instrumentalist, musicologist and publisher. He played the saxophone, oboe and bass guitar. He was born in Washington, D.C. He taught at the music and works of musician John Coltrane. As a musicologist, White published many musicological offerings through his music publishing firm, Andrew’s Music, including The Works of John Coltrane, Vols. 1 though 14: 701 transcriptions of John Coltrane’s Improvisations. White died in Silver Spring, Maryland on November 11, 2020 at the age of 78. == Related pages == *List of poets from North America ==References== Category:1942 births Category:2020 deaths Category:American jazz musicians Category:American R&B; musicians Category:Educators from Washington, D.C. title: Andrew White (saxophonist)
